abstract.para: Vertical profiles of nitrate, phosphate and ammonia for lake N2 reference for 1987

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

description.para:
Log of changes:
This data was taken from the file 89micln2.dat and separated out by lake and year by Neil Better on Jan 26, 1995

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: DATA FILE ENTERED BY: DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 8Oct91

para.literalLayout: Water samples were taken weekly from both sides of lake N-2. The sampling depths for the Control side were 0, 1, 3, 5, and 6 meters and the Treatment side were 0, 1, 3, 5, and 7 meters. Nutrients were analyzed using batch methods. SRP was measured using a non-extractive molybdate method (Strickland and Parsons 1969 and Wetzel and Likens 1979). Ammonia was measured by the phenate method (Wetzel and Likens 1979) and Nitrate/Nitrite using the cadmium reduction method.
Reference Citations: R.G. Wetzel & G.E. Likens. 1979. Limnological Methods. Saunders. Philadelphia.
